main event: On October 5, 1959, an unidentified flying object was observed in Lincoln, Nebraska, moving at a high rate of speed and making sharp turns.
interesting points: The object changed direction abruptly and was observed for approximately 5 to 8 minutes., It was described as bright, round, and metallic with a hazy glow around it., Witnesses initially thought the object might be a shooting star before realizing it was something unusual., The object appeared to stop momentarily at 90-degree turns., The observers noted that the object's speed was significantly faster than that of jets they were familiar with.
sighted object: a bright round object with a hazy glow
witness description: An Air Force pilot and two family members, including a son studying astronomy.
